Alternatively, if I move left to (8,9), I can then move down towards (8,6), which is also a path towards the apple at (7,6). However, I need to make sure that I don't run into any obstacles or the enemy snake.

Looking at the board state provided, the enemy snake is at (4,6), which is quite far from my current path. So, I don't need to worry about collision with the enemy snake right now. I should focus on avoiding self-collision, which can happen if I reverse direction or move into my own body.

Since I'm currently at (9,9), moving down to (9,8) seems like a logical first step because it reduces my y-coordinate, which is part of the target's y-coordinate (6). Moving down will help me get closer to the apple without immediately moving away from it.

Another thing to consider is the direction I'm moving. If I move down, I can continue moving down or left towards the apple. I also need to make sure that I don't get stuck in a corner or block my own path. Since I'm starting from the top-right corner, moving down or left are both viable options, but I should avoid moving right or up because that would take me away from the target.

In summary, the closest apple is at (7,6), and moving down from (9,9) to (9,8) is a good first step towards reaching that apple. I should continue moving in a direction that reduces my distance to the target while avoiding any potential collisions.
